revised_title: The Electro-Chemical Preservation of Metals in Marine Environments
tldr: Humphry Davy investigates the use of electro-chemical methods to prevent metal corrosion in marine environments, specifically focusing on copper sheathing in ships. He explores the effectiveness of various metals, such as iron and zinc, in forming insoluble compounds on the surface, which protect the underlying metal from corrosion and adhesion of weeds and shellfish.
